{0} does not miss that opportunity and swings their weapon at them, but they only succeed in cutting some fabric off their clothes.

Perhaps they dropped something in the process, however.

There was a yellow fabric on the ground.

{0} does not miss that opportunity and swings their weapon at them, but they fail to even brush their clothes due to the intruder's absurd speed.

A resident of the building next to that scene walks out, sees the ground where the intruder stood on, and screams.

"What the hell? You messed up the road in front of my house!"

"I demand compensation! Or at least call an insurance Office to deal with this!"

We decided to stop pursuing them to clean up the floor before the resident made an even bigger fuss.

successDesc:
Someone approaches as {0} waits in standby.

"This is a talisman from Q Corp. Keep it safe, and use it against the enemies if they make it in this deep."

The talisman was engraved with various glyphs we couldn't understand.

It certainly carried some power, however—it'll come in handy.

successDesc:
{0} decided to follow the Operation team. Someone in a bamboo hat walks up to {0} and delivers the mission.

"Place these talismans at their designated spots."

"Also, collect the scattered obstacles at a single place."

{0} followed the mission, but was left with a few surplus talismans and shards.

"About those... keep them. Just in case."

We decided to take whatever was left.
failureDesc:
"... Who are you? I haven't seen you around here before."

One of them looked at {0} curiously.

"It seems that someone has infiltrated our ranks and disguised themselves as a hare."

"Intruders must be removed."

We are suddenly surrounded by a dark and yellow presence, suffocating us.

dataList.behaveDesc: Who will lead us to a shelter?
successDesc:
{0} identifies a prospective shelter and calls the other Sinners over.

We all ran into the shelter and shut the door behind us—but upon turning around, we realize that the place was already occupied. It did look big enough to hold us all, however.

It was an odd mishmash of a bar and a restaurant—slightly awkward to be called a bar, not robust enough to be called a restaurant. But people were enjoying their meals here anyway.

"I-I beg your forgiveness for our intrusion!"

One of the Sinners shout, and that seemed to have been acceptable enough for the guests. They soon get over their initial confusion and nod affirmatively.

We could hear something moving outside the door, but... at least this shelter seems safe.
failureDesc:
{0} identifies a prospective shelter and calls the other Sinners over.

Thunk, thunk.

The door budged, but something heavy and hard seemed to have stopped it from opening.

Whoever's in there probably locked the door as soon as the Night in the Backstreets began.

We turn around, but our exit's been blocked by the wave of Sweepers as well.

We have no choice but to fight them.
